explanation: entity 0 claiming that 1 is true; any kind of quotation basically
0 is the reason why 1 is true; note that 0 and 1 could be formulas talking about the past
0 would cause 1 to be true; this also covers speculations about how things could have been if past events would have gone differently
entity 0 makes a normative statement that 1 should be made true
0 should be made true;note that it is unspecified who should see to make 0 true; this 'should' is distinct from specifying uncertainty
it is possible that 0 is true; in the sense that nothing prevents 0 from being true
1 would be bad for entity 0
1 is bad for entity 0
1 would be good for entity 0
1 is good for entity 0
entity 0 believes 1 is true;note that knowing is also treated as belief in our setting as people think they know but actually only believe
entity 0 has the ability to perform action 1
0 usually implies 1; in the sense that it might not always be the case but one can assume it is unless evidence for the contrary is presented
in situation/point in time 0 1 was/is/would be the case; e.g. 'in the industrial revolution {1}'; so named points in time together with something that was or will be tha case there
situations 0 and 1 are similar
entities 0 and 1 are similar; e.g. hitler comparisons
entity 1 prefers 2 to be true over 0; e.g. utterances like 'xy would rather 0 than 2'
entity 0 is accused of being biased
entity 0 is accused of being somehow unqualified to make meningful contributions to the dialogue; e.g. 'idiot'
entity 0 should make 1 true
entity 0 is accused of lying about truth of 1; 0's beliefs don't reflect what 0 sais
entity 0 is morally bad and should be condemned
truth of 0 is necessary for 1 to be true
if 0 then 1; note that if this is to be read in the sense that truth of 0 is responsible/causes truth of 1 then this is not tw right scheme
entity 0 is claimed to be part of entity 1 (most likely some group)
all entities in entity 1 have property 2 e.g. being an idiot
